summary: Telemonitoring, also known as remote patient monitoring, is a pivotal concept in the EU's health regulatory framework, facilitating the continuous observation of patients' health data from a distance. This practice enhances healthcare delivery by enabling timely interventions and reducing hospital visits, aligning with the EU's objectives for digital health transformation. Regulatory documents emphasize the importance of ensuring data protection and patient privacy in telemonitoring systems, adhering to the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). As a redirect to the preferred term "remote patient monitoring," telemonitoring underscores the integration of technology in healthcare, promoting efficiency and patient-centered care across member states.
